VEC.Q: How many slices are there in this pie chart?
VEC.A: There are {6} slices in this pie chart.

SRP.Q: In the pie chart, what is the next slice in the clockwise direction from slice Rice?
SRP.A: The next slice clockwise from slice Rice is {Corn}.

SRP.Q: In the pie chart, what is the next slice in the counterclockwise direction from slice Rice?
SRP.A: The next slice counterclockwise from slice Rice is {Oats}.

VPR.Q: Which crop has the largest proportion in this pie chart?
VPR.A: The crop with the largest proportion is {Rice}.

VPR.Q: Which crop has the smallest proportion in this pie chart?
VPR.A: The crop with the smallest proportion is {Soybeans}.

VE.A: The value of the Rice slice is {25}%.

VE.A: The value of the Corn slice is {17}%.

SC.Q: What is the difference between the values of Soybeans and Rice in this pie chart?
SC.A: The difference between Soybeans and Rice is {14}%.

SC.Q: What is the sum of the values of Wheat and Corn in this pie chart?
SC.A: The sum of Wheat and Corn is {31}%.

NF.Q: Which categories in the pie chart exceed 20.0%? Please list the category names and corresponding percentages.

NC.Q: Which is larger, the value of Rice or Oats?
Which is smaller, the value of Oats, Corn, or Wheat?

NC.A: The value of {Rice} is the largest.

MSR.Q: How many sectors have a percentage between 3% and 20%?
MSR.A: There are {4} sectors that have a percentage between 3% and 20%.

MSR.Q: Which three sectors have a sum of percentage less than 40%? List all possible combinations.
MSR.A: The possible combinations are: {(Wheat, Barley, Soybeans)}.
